author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Port Authority To Hold Annual Remembrance Service On September11Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Port Authority To Hold Annual Remembrance Service On September11
Agency to mark the day by flying world’s largest free flying flag at George Washington Bridge The Port Authority will hold an Interfaith Remembrance Service at St. Peter’s Church, located at the corner of Barclay and Church streets in Lower Manhattan, on Friday, September 11, at 2 p.m.
The service will honor the 84 Port Authority employees who were killed on September 11, 2001 in the terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center, as well as the victims of the 1993 World Trade Center bombing.
In addition, to honor those who were lost, the Port Authority will fly the world’s largest free-flying flag at the George Washington Bridge from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. on Friday, September 11.
Media interested in attending the St. Peter’s service should bring press credentials to the event.
Source:- The Port Authority
